intro: Allosorus tolocensis, commonly known as the Toloric sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. It produces a distinctive seed capsule that splits open to release its seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Allosorus tolocensis is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing the soil and supporting local biodiversity.
